titleStmt.title: G. W. Howe et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG9061

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: We the undersigned would respectfully say to his Excellency Gov Robinson that the Prisoner Victor Phillips who is a bout, to ask for a restoration to Liberty and society would say that during his confinement here has conducted himself with good deportment and has been a good prisoner

L, S, Prentiss
G W Howe Assistant Ke
L S Prentiss, Assistant Keeper
R. W. Lawler Assistant Keper
Jas S Sneed clk Ky Pnty
James Gallahn Guard
H. C. South -- --
D, M, Bowen
R W Willhoit -- -- Guard
Richard. Taylor. Guard,
